title: Failed to build `zlib %pgi@16` due to `pgcc-Error-Unknown switch: -include`
body:
I tried to build `zlib %pgi@16` in Spack, but failed with the message `pgcc-Error-Unknown switch: -include` . I find nowhere in zlib's package that `-include` flag is introduced.  It works if I build zlib against PGI without spack.

```
$ spack purge; spack clean zlib; spack install zlib %pgi@16

==> Created stage in /home/rpm/spack/var/spack/stage/zlib-1.2.11-47ulrkqewycl2ai7ms4phqjunqcalk7w

$ less /tmp/rpm/pytest-of-rpm/pytest-4/test_fetch0/tmp/spack-stage/spack-stage-8aqJBR/zlib-1.2.11/spack-build.out
...
/home/rpm/spack/lib/spack/env/pgi/pgcc -fpic -fPIC -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE=1 -DHAVE_HIDDEN -include zconf.h -DPIC -c -o objs/gzlib.o /home/rpm/spack/var/spack/stage/zlib-1.2.11
-47ulrkqewycl2ai7ms4phqjunqcalk7w/zlib-1.2.11/gzlib.c
pgcc-Error-Unknown switch: -include
pgcc-Error-Unknown switch: -include
make: *** [crc32.o] Error 1
make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
...
```

However, zlib works well with PGI and no `-include zconf.h` flag is introduce during manual installation.

```
$ cd /tmp
$ tar -xf /home/rpm/spack/var/spack/stage/zlib-1.2.11-47ulrkqewycl2ai7ms4phqjunqcalk7w/zlib-1.2.11.tar.gz
$ cd zlib-1.2.11
$ module purge; module load pgi
$ ./configure && make
```
